text: <@U3E300R6Z> In the car leasing demo, there is a shared service that performs consensus for all transactions, and generally in Fabric V0.6 all transactions are validated by all participants (although of course, the consensus network might be different from the business network). With endorsers in Fabric v1 you can choose how each transaction is validated, although hasn’t been implemented in the car demo yet.
Hi everyone, sorry for the spam but just a reminder about next Friday's Corda event in NYC ! <https://www.meetup.com/New-York-Corda-Meetup/events/237074253/>

attachments.title: New York Corda Meetup
attachments.text: Hi everyone, R3 and Rise are thrilled to invite you to our next Corda meet up event, hosted at the Rise theatre in midtown ! The event will be held on 10 February at 6pm. Acutely aware it's a Friday

text: Hi folks, if you are in SF for Construct and Hackfest, you might enjoy a Hyperledger meetup this Wednesday evening. Join us for networking and informal discussions, presentations on Hyperledger Fabric V1.0, and Sawtooth Lake. Brian Behlendorf and the Hyperledger Project team will be there.  RSVP here <https://www.eventbrite.com/e/sf-meetup-dive-into-fabric-v10-hyperledger-sawtooth-lake-tickets-31492945247>

attachments.title: SF Meetup: Dive Into Fabric V1.0. Hyperledger Sawtooth Lake
attachments.text: This is a joint meetup for Hyperledger SF and SF Bay Area meetup groups. Join us on February 1st and enjoy the talks with Hyperledger Project's Executive Director Brian Behlendorf, and others, in a friendly atmosphere!Agenda:5:45 - Doors open. Networking. 6:45 - Welcome. 7:00 - Talk #1. Hyperledger Project Updates, by Brian Behlendorf (Linux Foundation) 7:30 - Talk #2. Hyperledger Fabric V1.0, by Satoshi Oshima (Hitachi) 8:00 - Talk #3. Hyperledger Sawtooth Lake, by Dan Middleton (Intel)8:30 - Q&A break.8:40 - Fireside Chat.  9:00 - Q&A break and wrap-up. DETAILED AGENDA:5:45 - Doors open. Networking. Refreshments and drinks.6:45 - Welcome. 7:00 - Talk #1. Hyperledger Project UpdatesSpeaker: Brian Behlendorf, Executive Director of the Hyperledger Project at the Linux FoundationAs Executive Director, Brian's role is to grow and nurture the community in the best traditions of other Open Source projects, such as Linux and Apache. 7:30 - Talk #2. Hyperledger Fabric V1.0• Fabric 1.0 architecture• how it's different from V0.6• how it's different from other blockchain protocols Speaker:Satoshi Oshima is Senior Researcher of and R&D group and a member of the Open Source Technology Lab at Hitachi. He is also the leader of the firm's blockchain distributed ledger technology research team. He takes a particular focus on applying distributed ledger to supply chain and enterprise asset management.8:00 - Talk #3. Hyperledger Sawtooth Lake• Intro to Sawtooth Lake • Enhancements vs. 0.7 Speaker:Dan Middleton is Head of Technology for Intel's Blockchain and Distributed Ledger program8:30 - Q&A break.8:40 - Fireside Chat.  • Permissioned distributed ledgers: Industry requirements driving blockchain• The world of many networks: Integration of public and private blockchains 9:00 - Q&A break and wrap-up. Reach out to us. Thank you Moody’s Analytics for generously providing great venue and food for the meetup!
attachments.fallback: Eventbrite: SF Meetup: Dive Into Fabric V1.0. Hyperledger Sawtooth Lake

text: <@U0N4D2T61>  yes, the meetup will be recorded. No livestream unfortunately, but we'll share the videos in a week or two
hey all, can someone provide some guidance on the "msp" section of the fabric peer config?
in v0.6 the peer was able to enroll itself and create its own key material. does this msp section replace this mechanism?
new to hyperledger... i am interested in general use cases people are looking to build out and use..
quick question: has the <http://discuss.hyperledger.org/> ever lifted off? It look like the proposal to use this site never materialized.
Is there a way for the chaincode to query the blockchain for the information inside of the blocks directly on version hyperledger v 0.6?
<@U3YCR59HP> I suggest asking this on the fabric-ledger-dev channel

<@U3Z01TT5Y> Hi Gregg..There may be more, but the ones that I have heard in actual production include global finance where they are interacting with vendors to manage dispute resolution (IBM Global Finance with other vendors), Everledger managing provenance of wine to reduce fraud (<https://www.winefraud.com/chai-wine-vault/>), and China Blockchain Energy which I think is fighting carbon emissions. I have seen people up here have a lot of different use case across many industries though, and there is lot of insight coming to the Hackfests by Hyperledger where you see what is being worked on (there is one in San Fran tomorrow and Thursday)  Some popular use case I've heard are  financial industry (things like cross border remittance and other parts of trade finance), digital property management/provenance, supply chain, and so many others.
Is there any example or document how to configure multiple host?

hey all, I am very confused with the concept of msp. Does it mean that all the credentials about a blockchain network are pre-defined BEFORE the chain creation? and all the msp configuration is contained in the generic block which the peer uses to build their own local msp. So the msp manages the certificates and signing identities for peer/orderer on the chain? could anyone elaborate on that?
does the generic block contain all the identities (certificate) for all the members on the chain?
